chief.note: Commissioned to the court of Great Britain.
Commissioned to the court of His Britannic Majesty.

ended.note: Presented recall on or shortly before

chief.note: Commissioned to the court of His Britannic Majesty.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned after confirmation on November 18, 1803.

ended.note: Left England on or soon after

chief.note: Originally commissioned as Minister Plenipotentiary at the court of His Britannic Majesty and given a letter of credence as such, May 12, 1806, on the same day that he and Monroe were accredited jointly as Commissioners Plenipotentiary and Extraordinary on a special mission. When Monroe was preparing to leave London, he informed the Foreign Secretary that Pinkney would succeed him in the ordinary duties of the Legation; the British authorities declined to accept Pinkney’s 1806 letter of credence, but dealt with him informally until he was recommissioned and reaccredited.

ended.note: The United States declared war on Great Britain on

chief.note: Commission (issued during a recess of the Senate) not of record, but enclosed with an instruction of July 27, 1811. Russell received unofficial notice of the U.S. declaration of war on July 29, 1812, and suspended his official functions.
Commissioned to the court of the Prince Regent of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

Month and day not included on record copy of commission, which was issued during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 16, 1817, after confirmation. Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 20, 1825, after confirmation. Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

ended.note: Left post on or shortly before

chief.note: Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

ended.note: Had farewell audience on or shortly before

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on February 10, 1830, after confirmation. Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland. Nomination later rejected by the Senate.

No report has been found concerning Vail’s presentation of credentials as Chargé d’Affaires en titre; he had been received as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim on April 4, 1832. Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on June 24, 1850, after confirmation. Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
Commissioned to the court of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

Commissioned to England.

Commissioned to England.
Nomination of May 20, 1834, rejected by the Senate.
Commissioned to London; declined appointment.
Not commissioned; nomination rejected by the Senate.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Commissioned to London; declined appointment.
Not commissioned; nomination rejected by the Senate.

Took oath of office, but died in the United States before proceeding to post. A commission signed by the President during a recess of the Senate, which had not yet been dated and attested, was returned to the President by the Acting Secretary on December 6, 1946, Gardner having declined a recess appointment. Recommissioned on January 13, 1947.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Did not serve under this appointment.
